meanings.definition: To dial (a telephone number) again in order to reach the same person or service.
meanings.sent1: She redialled her friend's number to chat again.
meanings.sent2: I redialled the customer service line to inquire about my order.
meanings.sent3: After several failed attempts, she redialled with determination.
meanings.sent4: His persistence in redialling paid off when he finally got through.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the phone being redialled echoed in the room.

meanings.definition: Past tense of redial: dialed (a telephone number) again in order to reach the same person or service.
meanings.sent1: He redialled the emergency number when he realized he forgot to mention something important.
meanings.sent2: She redialled the wrong number and apologized for the mistake.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he redialled his ex's number by accident.
meanings.sent4: The memory of her redialling his number lingered in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The old phone automatically redialled the last number when picked up.
